basics.name: Alva Markelius
basics.summary: A highly driven and ambitious cognitive science and social robotics student and research assistant with a multidisciplinary social sciences and technological background. Deeply fascinated by the relationship between human cognition and AI and robotics, and in particular of emotion, anthropomorphism, gender and embodiment. Currently studying a part-time degree in AI Ethics & Society at University of Cambridge and keen to pursue a PhD in the intersection of social robotics and AI ethics.

work.name: Brain+/DICE Lab, University of Gothenburg
work.summary: Part of STINT initiation grant funded project between the University of Gothenburg and Ko√ß University researching humanoid social robotics, affective computing and digitalised gamified cognitive interventions. Researching human/robot interaction and gamified therapeutics for cognitive interventions for Danish Brain+.

education.institution: University of Cambridge, Lucy Cavendish College

awards.title: Nova 111 Student List 2023
awards.summary: Selected as one of the 111 young people with most potential in Sweden (Mathematics, Data, and Analytics).'
